page.title: 13BEA LOCH
page.content: Bea Loch is Sanday's{largest area of {inland water.}It is also the Island's {water supply.}At the east side of the Loch there is a{Pump House.}The water is taken from the Loch to the Pump House where it is{cleaned.}From there it is{pumped}up to the top of{Fea {Brae (50m),}where it is{stored}in a large tank. The tank can hold{42,000 {gallons}of water. The water is then piped to the individual houses and farms on the island. (i.e. all except one, Warsetter, as that building is on higher ground than the reservoir on Fea Brae.) The islanders use 50,000 gallons of water each day.
